required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Regulation of Blood Dendritic Cells During Immune Therapy for Hymenoptera Venom Allergy
clinical_study.official_title: Regulation of Blood Dendritic Cells During Immune Therapy for Hymenoptera Venom Allergy

brief_summary.textblock: Dendritic cells (DC) play a key role in the pathogenesis of allergic diseases. The regulation of blood dendritic cells in patients with hymenoptera venom allergy before and during immune therapy is unknown.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of myeloid DC and plasmacytoid DC in peripheral blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: Directly before, 1 hour after, and 12 months after initiation of immune therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Surface molecule expression on myeloid DC and plasmacytoid DC
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Directly before, 1 hour after, and 12 months after initiation of immune therapy

arm_group.description: Patients are treated with hymenoptera (bee or wasp) venom using subcutaneous injections. The initiation of immune therapy consists of a 52-hour-period in which patients are treated with increasing doses of hymenoptera venom. Afterwards, patients are treated with monthly subcutaneous injections with a fixed dose of hymenoptera venom. Blood will be collected directly before and 1 hour after initiation of immune therapy and after 12 months of immune therapy (directly before the next subcutaneous injection of hymenoptera venom).

intervention.description: Patients are treated with hymenoptera (bee or wasp) venom using subcutaneous injections. The initiation of immune therapy consists of a 52-hour-period in which patients are treated with increasing doses of hymenoptera venom. Afterwards, patients are treated with monthly subcutaneous injections with a fixed dose of hymenoptera venom. Blood will be collected directly before and 1 hour after initiation of immune therapy and after 12 months of immune therapy (directly before the next subcutaneous injection of hymenoptera venom).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with diagnosed hymenoptera venom allergy
- No previous treatments for hymenoptera venom allergy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with immunosuppressive agents
- Any malignant disease
- Infections within 1 week prior to the initiation of the treatment

reference.citation: Bratke K, Lommatzsch M, Julius P, Kuepper M, Kleine HD, Luttmann W, Christian Virchow J. Dendritic cell subsets in human bronchoalveolar lavage fluid after segmental allergen challenge. Thorax. 2007 Feb;62(2):168-75. Epub 2006 Aug 23.
